name: On Site Antiques - Web Application
client: On Site Antiques - Antiques sourcing company
description: A web application to help managing the catalog of items & clients/partners of an antiques sourcing company
notes:
A quite significant project for me as it was leveraging new technologies like _[Meteor](https://www.meteor.com)_, _[React.js](https://facebook.github.io/react/)_ & _[Redux](http://redux.js.org/)_ (the application state manager library by Dan Abramov & friends).

It allowed me to plan, design and code. I was really glad to be able to use only Javascript and to get to approach functional programming concepts that I came to really like.####

I was really seduced by _Meteor real-time reactivity_ concept and even though it posed specific challenges I had to take my skills to another level, also approaching more closely the world of [Node.js](http://www.nodejs.org) and the [npm](https://www.npmjs.com/) ecosystem.

The development of the application took place at a time where Meteor was moving very quickly, and even though it could be hard at times to follow the rapid pace, it forced me to take in a lot of information in a short time thus enhancing my ability to be ... reactive and responsive to changes.

I also had the opportunity to use the [Material UI](http://www.material-ui.com) React library that helped me in giving the application a clean and professional look as well as speeding up parts of the development process.

_Access to this project's code is private but can be obtained for review / hire purposes._

name: Point of Sale Extension for WooCommerce
description: A simple front-end for taking WooCommerce orders at the Point of Sale.
notes:
I was hired by this plugin author to help with the project. My work included working both on the back and client side.The project is a Web application using [Backbone.js](http://backbonejs.org/) and the [Marionette](https://marionettejs.com/) framework along with the WooCommerce REST API.####

This project also introduced me to the [Docker](https://www.docker.com/) technology that helps the project development workflow and testing.

Working with [@kilbot](https://github.com/kilbot) (the author) allowed me a first experience in working remotely on a software project, communicating via [Slack](http://www.slack.com) and [Github issues](https://guides.github.com/features/issues/), being able to make decisions and propose solutions. This led me to realize that this kind of projects were really the ones I would prefer to work on in the future.

name: Odysseus Extension for WooCommerce
description: A follow up to the WooCommerce Point of Sale extension - a shift to a React.js based code.
notes:
This project is aiming at a complete rewrite of the Point of Sale extension that was based on Backbone & Marionette. It takes inspiration from the [Calypso Project](https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso) - built by Automattic as the new wordpress.com interface.####

Development is currently in progress and has started by building the projects infinite lists (products, orders ...) based on [React Virtualized](https://bvaughn.github.io/react-virtualized/#/components/List). As I was getting more familiar with the _React Virtualized_ library and got to develop a custom solution for a specific requirement of the app I took a little time to package this solution for the community: [react-virtualized-with-drawer](https://github.com/thomasmery/react-virtualized-with-drawer) - a _React Function as Child Component_ to decorate a react-virtualized List/Table with Drawer capability.

This project also allowed me to start using the [Jest](https://facebook.github.io/jest/) Javascript testing framework along with the [Enzyme](https://github.com/airbnb/enzyme) testing utilities for React.

_Access to this project's code is private but can be obtained for review / hire purposes._

name: WooCommerce Record Store extension
description: An extension to help Record Store Owners with their e-commerce site.
notes:
I started to develop this extension as the need arose for a Record Store I was working with to import and get release infos for a great number of records. The very first version of the WC Record Store extension allows a store owner to easily fetch Artwork, Genres, Styles and Year of Release for the records he/she sells with WooCommerce.####

This project consitutes my first attempt to building a WordPress/WooCommerce extension from the ground up. It attempts to follow good practices and, for instance, is thoroughly tested with [PHP Unit](https://phpunit.de/), the [WordPress testing suite](https://make.wordpress.org/cli/handbook/plugin-unit-tests/) and the [WP-CLI project](http://wp-cli.org/).

This extension makes use of the [Php Discogs API](https://github.com/ricbra/php-discogs-api) project based on the [Guzzle PHP HTTP client](https://github.com/guzzle/guzzle). It fetches infos from the [Discogs API](https://www.discogs.com/developers/) as well as the [Spotify API](https://developer.spotify.com/web-api/). 

The extension should, in the future, build on its primary goals (helping with managing records informations) but also help store owners publish the record they sell within their e-commerce site on other platforms at the same time.

name: On Site Antiques - Web site
client: On Site Antiques - Antiques sourcing company
description: A simple site - a Gallery of image and a few pages.
notes:
Built with [Sage 9](https://github.com/roots/sage), a WordPress starter theme with a modern development workflow - part of the [Roots project](https://roots.io/).

This project is the foundation of a public theme to be released with designer [Monica Fraile](http://www.monicafraile.com), a really skilled visual designer (imho) with whom I have worked on a few other projects.####Special focus on the _attachment_ post type and building a custom gallery of progressively loaded images in a grid with detailed view and previous/next navigation.

This project is one of many that used the Sage starter theme and the Bedrock WordPress development boilerplate in an attempt to use [more modern PHP practices in a WordPress context](https://roots.io/bedrock-vs-regular-wordpress-install/) ([Composer](https://getcomposer.org/), automatic deployment with [Capistrano](http://capistranorb.com/) and [more](https://roots.io/bedrock/) ... ).

name: Balades Sonores
notes:
The current website is 5 years old now and I am in the middle of a quite significant overhaul & evolution for this parisian based record store.

We have planned a WooCommerce integration as well as making the site responsive and multilingual.

The project involves the import and the management of more than 15000 references & their variations. The amount of references as well as the ability for the store owner to easily get records infos from external sources (Artwork, tracklisting ... ) added to quite specific business rules regarding the management of the records are the main challenges of this project.

name: Thomas Mery's résumé
description: A small React application that presents what I have done & what I am doing ... code wise
notes: As I was in need of revamping my résumé it occured to me that it would be a good idea to take this opportunity to keep on training and use [create-react-app](https://github.com/facebookincubator/create-react-app), an easy to use build configuration for React.js application made by facebook to help developers. This project is also a good introduction to working with a simple [Progressive Web Application](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/). It is also planned to use this project to build a first simple [React Native](https://facebook.github.io/react-native/) application.

name: Vue Sur La Ville
description: A Single Page Site built on top of WordPress REST API.
notes: This project was a first opportunity to work with the emerging _Wordpress REST API_ (at the time a plugin). It also uses _HTML5 canvas_ to propose interesting transition between the projects of this design agency.

name: Cheese Up Your Life
description: A Single Page Site built on top of WordPress REST API.
notes: An hybrid Wordpress theme, originally a static site, adapted to make use of WordPress content via the WP REST API.

name: Princesse Amandine - Online Marketing Game platform
description: A platform for an ongoing marketing operation / game
notes: This project is a custom PHP web application allowing customers to win prizes after they purchased the brand product. It is built with the PHP [Yii Framework](http://www.yiiframework.com) and is comprised of a front and back end.#### The platform allows to create games and export participants listings. It also comprises an _Instant Win_ module.
